channel.title: Need help on some math problems
channel.description:
1.) 34+12x<76 2.) 76>34-12x
3.) From the situations described below, choose two situations that most interest you. Identify the variables invloved and write rules describing one of thoe variables as a function of the other. In each case, determine conditions for which each business is more economical that the other. Show how you compared the costs.
a.) A school club decides to have customized T-shirts made. The clothing shack will charge $30 for a setup costs and $12 for each shirt. The cost of having them made at Clever Creations is a $50 initial fee for the setup and $8 for each T-shirt.
1.) Business 1 (Clothing Shack)= Busniess 2 (Clever Creations)= Identify your variables ___=___________________ ____=___________________
Both companies charge the same price if you buy______________ ____________ is a better deal if you buy______________ ______________ is a better deal if you buy____________________
Help on any of the would be greatly appreciated :)

item.title: Need help on some math problems
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Heh, no need to be so aggressive Ollie.

But if anyone wants to know the answer to his question, you solve by first finding the discriminant of the quadratic and find where it equals less than 0 (which is the only way the initial quadratic would have no real roots):

b^2 - 4ac < 0
(4k)^2 - 4(k + 1)(9) < 0
16k^2 - 36k - 36 < 0
4k^2 - 9k - 9 < 0

[9 ± sqrt(81 - 4(4)(-9))] / 8
(9 ± 15) / 8

24 / 8 = 3 or
-6 / 8 = -3/4

As -3/4 is less than 3 anyway, the range of k where the original quadratic has no real roots is k < 3

@Ollie: You only switch the inequality sign when dividing/multiplying by negative values.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help on some math problems

item.title: Need help on some math problems
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

IcyPimp:

A)1) Sounds like sixth grade work, lol. I could’ve told you that.

ok smartass,

solve this:

Find the range of values of k that give the equation no real roots.

(k + 1)x^2 + 4kx + 9 = 0

this should be EASY for you, i did this in 3 minutes including reading question, shapening pencil and writing the answer down

item.title: Need help on some math problems
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

1.) 34+12x<76
12x < 76 - 34
12x < 42
x < 3.5 (or it could be x > 3.5, i forgot because you may have to change the inequality if you divide)

2.) 76>34-12x
76 + 12x > 34
12x > -42
x > -3.5 (or it could be x < -3.5, i forgot because you may have to change the inequality if you divide)

3.) a) 1)

Business One:
$30 Setup
$12 a Shirt

Business Two:
$50 Setup
$8 a Shirt

Both companies charge the same price if you buy 2 Shirts With Business Two and Three Shirts with Business One
Business One is a better deal if you buy Three shirts or less
Business Two is a better deal if you buy Three shirts or More

i wasnt too sure on what you were asking for Qn3, but i did what i thought was right

Read full topic
